cause.description:
High School Contest
http://www.thebetterhour.com
$10,000 First Prize, up to $40,000 total prizes. Register to get online guidelines and contest rules. While this is a U.S. based contest, we welcome secondary school students from countries around the world.
In commemoration of this 200th anniversary of the 1807 abolition of the Trans Atlantic Slave Trade. Awards made available by a grant from the John Templeton Foundation.
Inspired by the vision and character of leading activist William Wilberforce and his crusade to end slavery and transform culture. Craft a project that will make your world a better place. Enlist others to help execute your plan and document it online.
1. End Human Trafficking and Slavery
2. William Wilberforce is and enduring model for change
3. Individuals can make a difference.
cause.mission: Engage High Students to Follow the Model of William Wilberforce
cause.name: The Better Hour: The Legacy of William Wilberforce
